intro: Cheiridopsis gamoepensis, commonly known as the Gamsberg carpetbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to its arid habitat. It is well adapted to rocky, sandy soils and can thrive in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
